intro: Litsea breviumbellata, commonly known as the broad-leaved litsea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its simple, elliptical leaves that are usually smooth and glossy. It produces small, white flowers that are clustered in axillary inflorescences, followed by small, spherical berries. The botanical features of Litsea breviumbellata make it an important component of the understory vegetation in its native habitats.
